title.narrative: Technical support on employment policies for youth, women and migrants

description.narrative: The project aims to improve employment policies with particular attention to women and young people. The focus of this intervention will be threefold: (a) implementation of the National Employment Policy in view of supporting the introduction of employment objectives in other sectoral strategies, including the industrial and competitiveness policy; (b) design and implementation of Territorial/Local Employment Pacts based on the role of the tripartite Territorial Commissions for Consultations and Collective Bargaining; and (c) implementation of the recommendations from the functional audit of the Public Employment Service (PES), particularly with regard to the changes in the organizational setup, the extension and improvement of services and outreach of the PES (regional offices, activation packages, monitoring and evaluation functions). In the framework of the Decent Work Country Programme Moldova 2016-2020, the intervention seeks to enhance capacities to define and implement a more comprehensive employment framework at national and local levels in line with the new UN Joint Programming Framework (UNDAF 2018-2022), as well as Moldova’s commitment to the Sustainable Development Goals

department.narrative: Departement of Partnerships and Field Support (PARDEV)

sector.narrative: ILO Results Framework 2020-2021: Output 3.5. Increased capacity of member States to formulate and implement labour market programmes and employment services for transitions to decent work over the life course, with particular focus on young and older workers

transaction.ref: MDA/16/02/RBS-2019-MDA130 - Comprehensive employment policy designed, including youth and migration dimensions
